venue.name: Moot Court Room, Suffolk University Law School

item.description:
Can free trade be fair?

 

Can fair trade be free?

 

What is the impact of trade barriers?

 

"From subsidies to tariffs to quotas, a variety of standards affect trade but are they effective or even sensible? What are the effects of a chosen trade method on international borders, environmental and labor regulations, and bureaucracy? Is there a compromise that combines partnership and transparency with unfettered commerce?"

 

Ford Hall Forum board member and Boston Globe columnist Jeff Jacoby discusses these questions with fair trade advocate Rodney North, and free trade supporter Donald Boudreaux.

Rodney North, is a communications consultant/former Board Chair of Equal Exchange and co-owner of the largest fair trade enterprise in North America.

Donald Boudreaux, Ph.D., is a Professor of Economics at George Mason University and former President of libertarian think tank Foundation for Economic Education, 

 

If there is enough interest, we'll meet afterward to hold a discussion of the Inquisitives on the questions of free trade, protectionism, and fair trade.

 

When: Thursday, April 28, 6:30 p.m. to 8:00 p.m.

Where: Moot Court Room, Suffolk University Law School

120 Tremont St, Boston MA

Be sure to register for a free ticket to this lecture:

http://www.fordhallforum.org/programs/trade-offs
item.name: Ford Hall Forum: Trade-Offs: Can Free Be Fair?
